abstract: Former Pres Bill Clinton and former aides say that he was able to accomplish much during his years in office despite facing extreme partisanship and series of highly personal attacks; comments, coming ahead of expected presidential run by Hillary Clinton, appear intended to discount arguments that Pres Obama's efforts have been undermined by partisanship; some experts maintain that Obama faces more difficulties than Clinton did.
lead_paragraph: The former president argues that the personal attacks were even harsher when he was in the White House, raising the question of whether a bitter atmosphere should be an excuse for political gridlock.

headline.main: Toxic Partisanship? Bill Clinton Says He Had It Worse, Yet Got Things Done
headline.print_headline: Toxic Partisanship? Clinton Says He Had It Worse, Yet Got Things Done

snippet: The former president argues that the personal attacks were even harsher when he was in the White House, raising the question of whether a bitter atmosphere should be an excuse for political gridlock....
